revised_title: Molecular Electric Polarization and Insulating Properties of Non-Conducting Bodies
tldr: The author, Carlo Matteucci, investigates the electric properties of insulating or non-conducting bodies and demonstrates Faraday's hypothesis of molecular electric polarization. He also observes that the insulating power of a substance is greater in proportion to its degree of polarization and that the electric capacity of a conducting body is higher when surrounded by insulating substances like sulphur.
